section.title: Viewer properties
section.para: The look of the viewing mechanism can be changed by using different fonts, colours and icons.
Fonts can be specified for the following areas:-

list.para: normal, for edit fields and object labels in fields
class, for labeling class icons
title, for top-level form and list titles
label, for the field labels
debug, for the listing in the debug dialog
status, for text on the status bar

section.para: A particular font can be specifed for an area by specifying
Where the <area> is the name and the <font> is specified according the Font.decode() specification (see java.awt.Font). This essentially is a contationation of the name, style and size as below:
In addition to the font the amount of space between lines of text can also be specified.

Exploration menus are only shown during exploration, and not when running as a client or standalone. This property allows you to turn off the default displaying of exploration option during exploration: to then bring the options up you can hold down the Ctrl key while right-clicking to bring up the menu.
For debugging purposes details about the mouse interaction can be seen in a separate window. Add the following property to show the window.

The colour properties are prefixed with 'nakedobjects.basic-gui.color' and take a numerical value. The most useful form is in hexadecimal where where the six digits are grouped into twos to represent the red, green and blue components. The following example specifies the colours green, red and black respectively.
section.comment: to correct and complete this list

list.para: application.background, for all window backgrounds
window.background, for all window backgrounds
foreground, the basic colour for drawing the views
text.normal, for text being displayed
text.edit, for text being edited
text.highlight, for area of text being highlighted for deleting/copying
text.cursor, for the text-edit cursor bar
field.label, for the text used to label fields in forms and headings in table columns
debug.label, for the OID labels shown when debugging
field.normal, for the outline of value fields
field.highlight, for the outline of value fields when they are being edited
field.selected, for the marker in a selection field, i.e. radio button, check box, when selected
field.unselected, for the marker in a selection field, i.e. radio button, check box, when not selected
object.identified, for the label of an object when the mouse is over it
object.dragging, for the label of an object when it is being dragged
object.can-drop, for the label of a target object when it will accept the drop object
object.cant-drop, for the label of a target object when it will not accept the drop object

section.para: The default icons - for instances and unknown objects (which is used when a specified icon cannot be found) - can also be specifed as a properties. Theses require a file name for a image file that will be found in the images directory. The fallback image is Unknown.gif by default.

list.para: image-directory alternative directory to load the images from
fallback-image the image to use if no other image can be found
